Uses of Interface
tcpassos.pipeline.UnaryPipeline

  • Uses of UnaryPipeline in tcpassos.pipeline

    Classes in tcpassos.pipeline that implement UnaryPipeline
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    AtomicUnaryPipeline<T>
    A pipeline that can be atomically replaced.
    Methods in tcpassos.pipeline that return UnaryPipeline
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    UnaryPipeline<T>
    UnaryPipeline.Builder.build()
    Builds the pipeline
    default UnaryPipeline<T>
    UnaryPipeline.connect(BasePipeline<? super T,Optional<T>> nextPipe)
    Connect this pipeline at the beginning of another pipeline
    static <T> UnaryPipeline<T>
    UnaryPipeline.empty()
    Returns an empty pipeline whose output will be the same input element
    static <T> UnaryPipeline<T>
    UnaryPipes.filtering(Predicate<T> filter)
    Returns a single-step pipeline that will process the input element and return the same element to the next stage if the element is valid according to the filter, null otherwise
    default UnaryPipeline<T>
    UnaryPipeline.forceConnect(BasePipeline<? super T,Optional<T>> nextPipe)
    Connect this pipeline at the beginning of another pipeline without checking if the output element is present
    static <T> UnaryPipeline<T>
    UnaryPipes.giving(Supplier<T> supplier)
    Returns a single-step pipeline that will always return the value given by the supplier as an output element
    static <T> UnaryPipeline<T>
    UnaryPipes.giving(T value)
    Returns a single-step pipeline that will always return the value given as an output element
    static <T> UnaryPipeline<T>
    UnaryPipes.mapping(Function<T,T> mapper)
    Returns a single-step pipeline that will process the input element from a function and return the transformed element
    static <T> UnaryPipeline<T>
    UnaryPipes.processing(Consumer<T> processor)
    Returns a single-step pipeline that will process the input element and return the same element to the next stage
    static <T> UnaryPipeline<T>
    UnaryPipes.running(Runnable runnable)
    Returns a single-step pipeline that will run a code and return the same input element to the next stage
